About me

Thanks for visiting! My name is Maarten Moerland. I'm an IT student from the Netherlands. After working in the mechanical engineering and production sector for seven years I have decided to follow my passion for IT and start the journey to become a full-stack developer.

On this website, I showcase some of the work that I have done, discuss the tools and languages I used to develop the projects and summarize what I have learned doing those projects. You can also reach out to me trough the contact form at the bottom!

Catch the follower

Catch the follower is a school project that I have created with the following learning goals:

  • Getting familiar with Visual Studio and C#
  • Learn about UML and "object oriented programming"
  • Learn about GIT and group workflow
The mechanics of the game are simple. The player controls the character that starts in the top right of the screen and the objective is to trap the enemy (bottom right character) with boxes. When you come in a three-square range of the enemy it will sense your presence and will follow your character in an effort to catch it. The game is over when you catch the enemy, or when it catches your character.

Close Project

Reward Recycle

Reward recycle is a school project that I have created with the following learning goals:

  • Getting more familiar with MySQL
  • Getting more familiar with embedded systems
  • Getting familiar with the ASP.NET CORE Framework
  • Getting familiar with Python
Reward recycle is a product that consists of a web page where users can register to receive an NFC tag and an embedded system that scans the tag to reward users with points. The goal of the project is to reward users for making use of separation garbage disposals. The NFC scanning interface at the garbage disposal is powered by a RaspBerry Pi running a python script.

Close Project

Dif Jobs

Dif Jobs is one of the first web development projects I have done. It is a small project designed to connect students to companies in the "Dutch Innovation Factory". The techniques and tools that have been used to create this project are:

  • JetBrains PhpStorm
  • HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript and jQuery
  • MySQL, MySQL workbench and PhpMyAdmin
